Brand Guide

Visual identity for regenerative innovation

This brand guide captures the essence of A Curious Tractor—earthy yet innovative, rooted in tradition yet looking forward. Our visual identity reflects the intersection of agricultural heritage and technological possibility, community wisdom and bold imagination.

Logo & Identity

The ACT logo combines agricultural symbolism with growth metaphors, representing the transfer of capacity from tools to community flourishing.

Primary Logo

Use on light backgrounds. Minimum height: 40px. Maintain clear space equal to the height of the logo.

Logo Elements

🚜
Tractor Body

Represents tools, infrastructure, and capacity-building support

⚡
PTO Shaft

Power take-off: transferring capacity to community initiatives

◆
Growth Elements

Community flourishing and regenerative outcomes

Logo Usage

Guidelines for proper logo usage to maintain brand integrity across all touchpoints.

✓ Do

  • ✓ Use the primary logo on light backgrounds
  • ✓ Maintain clear space equal to logo height
  • ✓ Keep minimum height of 40px for digital use
  • ✓ Use high-resolution files for print
  • ✓ Scale proportionally

✗ Don't

  • ✗ Stretch or distort the logo
  • ✗ Change logo colors or add effects
  • ✗ Place on busy or low-contrast backgrounds
  • ✗ Rotate or flip the logo
  • ✗ Use below minimum size

Voice & Tone

How we communicate reflects our values: respectful, authentic, hopeful, and grounded in community wisdom.

Respectful

We honour Indigenous knowledge, cultural protocols, and community expertise. We listen before we speak and acknowledge the wisdom that exists in every community.

Authentic

We speak plainly about challenges and opportunities. No buzzwords or jargon. We share failures as readily as successes and admit when we don't know something.

Hopeful

We believe in community agency and the possibility of regenerative change. Our language emphasizes possibilities, assets, and potential rather than deficits.

Grounded

We're practical and solution-oriented. We talk about real tools, measurable outcomes, and concrete next steps. Vision balanced with pragmatism.

Brand Voice & Communication

Our voice reflects who we are: grounded yet visionary, humble yet confident, warm yet challenging, poetic yet clear. We speak the language of regenerative change.

Voice Attributes

◆ Grounded yet Visionary

We plant seeds today for forests tomorrow. Practical wisdom meets ambitious dreams.

"Every story is a seed. Every seed is a possibility."

🤲 Humble yet Confident

We don't have all the answers, but we're cultivating solutions together.

"Your experience is the soil from which solutions grow."

🔥 Warm yet Challenging

Let's get our hands dirty with the hard truths. We invite participation while confronting systems.

"The time for change is now. We've prepared the soil, planted the seeds—now we cultivate revolution."

🎨 Poetic yet Clear

We use metaphor to illuminate, not obscure. Beauty and clarity can coexist.

"Look what we've grown together! Every harvest feeds the whole community."

Communication in Action

When Listening

"We're here to learn from your wisdom. Your experience is the soil from which solutions grow."

When Teaching

"Let's explore this together. Like tending a garden, the best learning happens when we all get our hands dirty."

When Advocating

"The time for change is now. We've prepared the soil, planted the seeds—now we cultivate revolution."

When Celebrating

"Look what we've grown together! Every harvest is proof that community-led change bears the sweetest fruit."

Core Mantras

◆ "Every story is a seed. Every seed is a possibility. Every possibility is a future we cultivate together."

"We don't drive the tractor—we hand over the keys."

"Success isn't measured by what we build, but by what communities build when we're no longer needed."

"We're not building an empire—we're planting a forest where everyone can thrive."

Voice Guidelines

These guidelines ensure our voice remains consistent across all communications while staying true to our regenerative values.

✅ Do

  • Use agricultural metaphors naturally
  • Centre community voices and ownership
  • Speak with humility about our role
  • Use "we cultivate" not "we create"
  • Say "communities lead" not "we help"
  • Include "every story is a seed" when appropriate
  • Be specific about community benefits
  • Use warm, inclusive language

❌ Don't

  • Position ACT as the hero or savior
  • Use corporate jargon or buzzwords
  • Make promises we can't keep
  • Speak for communities
  • Use extractive language ("leverage," "utilize")
  • Overuse metaphors to the point of confusion
  • Be vague about community ownership
  • Appropriate Indigenous concepts

Key Messaging Framework

Community-First

Always lead with community agency, ownership, and self-determination.

Regenerative Innovation

Technology that heals rather than extracts, builds rather than depletes.

Power Transfer

We exist to transfer capacity, not accumulate it.

Long-term Thinking

Planting seeds today for forests that will outlast us.

A Curious Tractor

Dismantling extractive systems through regenerative innovation
